label.intro:
A literature review situates a study in its theoretical and local context; between the global scientific knowledge and the locally specific knowledge. In most fields, there are few publications which are relevant at both levels and so a study needs to engage separately in literature that is theoretically interesting, and contextually relevant.

Later on in the research process, when you’re sharing your results with others, it’s vital that you reference all literature that you reference in your work: this simultaneously credits others for their work and protects you from any mistakes they may have made!
